intro: Lucilia lundii, commonly known as the tropical housefly, is a species of fly found in warm climates. It belongs to the family Calliphoridae, which includes blowflies and their relatives. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are usually opposite and oval in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rapid growth and ability to adapt to various soil types make it a common weed in agricultural areas.
